Melt the butter in a soup pot. Add the onions and season with salt & pepper, cook over medium heat until golden. It may take 30-40 minutes. Add the sherry, port or red wine and scrap any browned bits that have stuck to the bottom of the pan. Add beef stock and simmer for 30 minutes. Season with salt and pepper if needed. Toast the baguette slices on a baking sheet under the broiler. Combine the olive oil and garlic in a small bowl and spread on the toasted baguette slice. Place soup in bowls. Top with baguette slices and sprinkle with cheese. Place under the broiler until the cheese melts, about 2 minutes.
